instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message: no liquid or damages to see..any usual suspect?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message: 5V present on the ports? Any other USB devices working like BT and trackpad in boot menu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 13244"]5V present on the ports? Any other USB devices working like BT and trackpad in boot menu?[/QUOTE]

No, 5v gives 0. something at first touch and goes down to 0. - TP and BT worked just fine but no usb on both ports..strange.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message: Check if <SIGNAL>USB_EXTB_OC_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>USB_EXTA_OC_L</SIGNAL> are high. Disconnect right IO board and see if USB on the board has power.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message: That means that J4600 is drawing too much current. Either a short on the 5V line from <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> to J4600 or dead <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 13733"]That means that J4600 is drawing too much current. Either a short on the 5V line from <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> to J4600 or dead <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>.[/QUOTE]
Ok so I got today a message USB DEVICES DISABLED unplug the device using too much power etc.. guess J4600 drawing too much current, what is the options here? considering ultrasonic to begin with but what if it doesn't help? only replacment?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no USB from both ports
threads.message: I already gave you the possibilities, fix this thing. U/S is not gonna do anything....
